div.p: Ensemble mean of simulated counterfactual (thin black) plus standard deviation of the 100 members (grey envelope) and factual climate condition (red) of mean surface temperature ( a), annual rainfall ( b), number of very hot days ( c) and number of very heavy rainy days ( d). See Table 1 for the definition of the climate indices. The thick black line represents the observed annual mean temperature ( a) and annual rainfall ( b) from CRU data. All values are shown on average across West Africa (20°W to 15°E; 4°N to 18°N).
